summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed individual to appear and testify in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell on November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m. at 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906. The subpoena is dated July 13, 2021, and signed by the U.S. Attorney.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the subpoena, United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).

persons.name: A Rey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the subpoena.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Maxwell Case
events.description: The subpoena commands an individual to appear and testify before the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York, Southern District of New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A subpoena was issued on July 13, 2021, for an individual to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (20 Cr. 330).
The commanded appearance was scheduled for November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m. at 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906.
The subpoena was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, signed by U.S. Attorney A Rey Strauss.
Failure to comply with the subpoena would constitute contempt of court and subject the individual to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The document is a formal court order demanding personal appearance and testimony, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in the Maxwell case as of late 2021.
